the condition of having no sense of taste: In medical terms the inability to taste is known as ageusia. Anosmia and ageusia are a common presentation of Covid-19 infection. Compare
anosmia
More examplesFewer examplesThe loss of the senses of smell (anosmia) and taste (ageusia) are the most common chemosensory disorders.One experience common to many radiotherapy patients is hypogeusia, the partial loss of the sensation of taste, or ageusia, the complete loss of this sensory function.In this paper, we report three cases of pediatric patients with COVID-19 infection who presented with anosmia and/or ageusia.
